content.description: Fun S shaped crack on left side of crag, gets pretty burly in the off width section. Chill top, good trees for nat anchors up top.

Started on this project too late on the season, got all the moves but never linked them clean. The placements look ok, first pro is after a big move at the start, if you botch it will be like 6 foot fall onto a dirt ledge. Move into the meat of it and onto the finger crack, some wire placements for the crux. Up top is pretty easy climbing and a few placements with varying pucker factor. Single bolt anchor, sits about 7-8 feet left of the Gray Dihedral anchors.
content.protection: Small/medium cams, small nuts for the finger crack , single bolt, can go on TR

content.description: Start with a smear and heel hook using opposing sidepulls for hands. Move up and right on decent holds to reach the tricky top out.
content.location: Located on the Cage Boulder near the massive boulder featuring Kruezer doctorman and another crack climb. A few hundred feet up and right from parking

content.description: Fingers to off fingers crack that flares near the top.
content.protection: .75 and smaller, offsets could be handy
content.location: Route is located on the right side (climbers right) of the largest boulder and ascends the obvious crack.

content.description: Far right of crag, two bolt anchor w biners, you can head down fixed lines to reach them. Found old tatt from Kelsey Gray, hence the name. Super fun, can be really wet. Bring a tool and tighten them anchor bolts.
content.location:
At the Offwidth Crag 

Far right, up and behind Alaskan Abortion

content.description:
Fin shaped feature separated from the wall short route, pretty much layback all day, good start, nice rest, then offwidth and higher angle to the finish.

 At the Offwidth crag
content.protection: Can set up a TR by climbing up the backside and setting some cams can wrap the top rock too. Big cams

content.description:
Climbing is on a selection of granite boulders and crags that rise just above the sea on an overlooking hillside. Much is still undeveloped including an overhanging wall of patina features that could bring Skagway to a new level of difficulty. One notable route sits on the house sized boulder at the base of the hill: it is 40 feet of laser cut finger and off finger crack climbing. Numerous bouldering problems can be found within a short walk of the road. Keep an eye out for the yet undeveloped "off width crag" just up the hill and the futuristic overhanging finger crack splitting a prominent arch.

 Everything is TR suitable with some long natural anchors, or bring your rack and get it done. Still room for development all over the area. If you've found the Kruzerman route, head up and to the left about another 150 feet and you’ll find the routes. There is some hanging pink tape in spots.

To get to the topout you can walk up directly to the left of S-Off.
